business.headline: Immensely grateful: Shaktikanta Das thanks PM Modi on last day as RBI GovernorIn a series of tweets, Das extended his thanks to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, various stakeholders, including financial sector participants, economists, industry bodies.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as auto stocks shed in early trade; Swiggy up 4% The S&P BSE Sensex was down 10.62 points to 81,497.84, while the Nifty50 lost 1.85 points to 24,617.15.
Boeing layoffs: Hundreds in Washington and California face job lossesThe recent layoffs are part of a larger reduction that aims to cut around 17,000 jobs from Boeing's global workforce.
Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta explains why fixed income MFs belong in your portfolioFixed-income MFs, as Radhika Gupta suggests, enhance equity portfolios with stability, flexibility, and tax efficiency.

Stocks to watch today: Adani stocks, Vodafone Idea, Godrej Consumer, Tata MotorsAs markets open today, several stocks, including Vodafone Idea, Adani stocks, Tata Motors, etc are likely to be in focus due to recent announcements and developments.
Sanjay Malhotra appointed as new RBI GovernorThe government on Monday appointed Revenue Secretary Sanjay Malhotra as the next Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor.

1990-batch IAS, IITian: Meet Sanjay Malhotra, newly-appointed RBI GovernorCurrently serving as the Revenue Secretary in the Ministry of Finance, Malhotra has over 33 years of diverse experience spanning finance, taxation, power, information technology, and mining.

Aditya Birla Group set to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaAddressing the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla said, "Across our businesses, we are committed to significantly scaling up our investments. I foresee the Group investing over Rs 50,000 crore in the next few years."

Aditya Birla Group to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaSpeaking at the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of PM Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla highlighted the state's potential driven by its mineral wealth, infrastructure, tourism, and renewable energy capacity.
Sanjay Malhotra appointed new RBI Governor, to succeed Shaktikanta DasRevenue Secretary Sanjay Malhotra has been appointed as the new Reserve Bank of India Governor.

Air India places order to purchase 100 more Airbus aircraftThis new purchase comes in addition to the 470 aircraft already ordered from Airbus and Boeing in 2023, boosting Air India's total Airbus orders this year to 350 aircraft.
HDFC Bank hikes MCLR for short-term loans. What borrowers need to knowHDFC Bank raises MCLR for short-term loans by 5 bps, affecting borrowing costs and EMIs, while long-term rates remain unchanged.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as FMCG stocks witness decline; Godrej Consumer down 9%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.66 points to close at 81,508.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 58.80 points to end at 24,619.00.

Adani Group unveils Rs 7.5 lakh crore investment plan for RajasthanKaran Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone, made the announcement while addressing the Rising Rajasthan Global Investment Summit held in Jaipur.
Dabur, Marico, Godrej Consumer: Why major FMCG stocks are tumbling todayGodrej Consumer Products shares declined as much as 11% in early trade and was the top loser among all major FMCG companies.

Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill 2024: What it means for youThe 2024 Banking Laws Amendment Bill allows multiple nominees, and grants banks more flexibility in auditor remuneration, fostering a more inclusive and efficient banking system.

Nisus Finance Services IPO allotment: Check status, latest GMP and other details Investors can check the allotment status on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or via the registrar, Skyline Financial Services. The company's shares are expected to list on the BSE SME platform on December 11, Wednesday.

Can CEAT shares hit Rs 4,000? Brokerages bet big on Camso acquisitionWith the stock rallying sharply by 12% today, market watchers are keenly assessing whether CEAT can sustain its momentum and inch closer to the coveted Rs 4,000 mark.
Explained: Why NHPC share price rose 5% in early trade todayNHPC's share price rose nearly 5% in early trade on Monday, touching a day's high of Rs 88.82 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.
Assigned two UANs? Here's how you can rectify it Resolve the issue of being assigned two UANs by following these simple steps to consolidate your EPF details into a single account.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Lalu Prasad takes vulgar jibe at Nitish Kumar's women's rally: Only to letchRJD chief Lalu Yadav sparked controversy on Tuesday with a sexist comment about Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Mahila Samwad Yatra, suggesting it was intended to "letch at women".

6 dead, 49 injured as bus rams vehicles, pedestrians in Mumbai; driver arrestedMumbai Bus Accident: At least six people died and 49 were injured when a BEST bus lost control in Mumbai's Kurla area, crashing into pedestrians and vehicles. The driver has been arrested as authorities investigate.

Farming yields Rs 4,500 a month, less than what you'd splurge on a dinner dateFarmers in India aren't a pampered lot as they are perceived to be. A farming family ends up earning just Rs 4,500 a month from agriculture, according to a Nabard study. Even after resorting to all other avenues, including non-farm jobs, a farming household manages just Rs 13,600 a month.

Immensely grateful: Shaktikanta Das thanks PM Modi on last day as RBI GovernorIn a series of tweets, Das extended his thanks to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, various stakeholders, including financial sector participants, economists, industry bodies.
Can you live forever like Bryan Johnson wants to?Can money, science, and obsession really cheat death? US tech millionaire Bryan Johnson thinks so.

INDIA bloc MPs to move no-confidence motion against Jagdeep DhankharParliament Session Live: Expressing strong discontent against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankar during proceedings in the Upper House on Monday, the Opposition INDIA bloc is all set to move a no confidence motion against the Vice President under Article 67(b). The decision came after Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge and other Opposition Rajya Sabha MPs accused Dhankar of holding "bias" towards the ruling party during the uproar in the House over BJP levelling charges that American businessman George Soros and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi had some "links". On Tuesday, parliament braces for another stormy day as further chaos is expected on the floor. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for latest updates.

McDonald's 'review bombed' after CEO murder suspect's arrest, Google steps inFollowing the arrest of Luigi Mangione, a suspect in the murder of UnitedHealth CEO Brian Thompson, Google removed derogatory reviews of McDonald's in Altoona, citing violations of its review policies.

No change to India's batting order in intense training session in AdelaideIndia players went straight into the nets after their heavy loss in Adelaide. KL Rahul and Yashavsi Jaiswal continued to come out to bat first in the nets, indicating that they might continue to open in the Test series.

Man celebrates Pushpa 2 in Gangamma Thalli look in viral video from KeralaA Kerala man celebrated Pushpa 2: The Rule in a Gangamma Thalli look with Allu Arjun's face painted on his belly. A video of him dancing outside a movie theatre went viral.
University of Bath School of Management: A Leader in Global Business EducationCombining top-ranked MSc programmes with practical knowledge for future corporate leaders.

India ties solid, Hasina's remarks raising tensions: Yunus to Foreign SecretaryDuring his meeting with Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri in Dhaka, Muhammad Yunus asked India to "clear the clouds", which "cast a shadow" over the ties between the two neighbours.

Kiren Rijiju jabs Rahul Gandhi over 'PM-Adani' interview: Enjoys creating tamashaUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju said while Rahul Gandhi enjoys creating a tamasha and abusing PM Modi, other MPs have responsibilities towards the people who have elected them.

Here's how yet-to-be-released Squid Game 2 earned Golden Globe nominationNetflix's Squid Game season 2 earned a Golden Globe nomination for Best Drama Series before its release. Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA) accepted early screeners, adhering to guidelines.

Meet Harmeet Dhillon, Trump's civil rights warrior who once shut up Piers MorganTrump praised Harmeet K Dhillon for her consistent defence of civil liberties, highlighting her work against social media companies and corporations that use "woke policies" to discriminate against workers.

Luigi Mangione: Ivy League graduate, now suspect in insurance chief's killingLuigi Mangione, 26, accused in UnitedHealthcare CEO's murder, faces scrutiny over strained ties to the medical industry, a pivotal back surgery, and his year-long disappearance.
Spider-Man meets Stree: Shraddha Kapoor, Andrew Garfield in new viral picShraddha Kapoor met Andrew Garfield on the red carpet of the Red Sea Film Festival. Fans called it an iconic crossover.

Pannun's outfit threatens Indian-origin Canada MP for opposing 1984 riots motionThe threat by Sikhs for Justice comes days after Chandra Arya said he was the only MP in Canadian Parliament to oppose a motion to declare the 1984 anti-Sikh riots as 'genocide'.
SM Krishna, former Union Minister and Karnataka Chief Minister, dies at 92SM Krishna, remembered for shaping Karnataka's growth and his influential role in Indian diplomacy, died at 92.

UnitedHealthcare CEO murder suspect arrested, McDonald's employee alerted copsPolice said a fake New Jersey ID card, matching the one the suspect, Luigi Mangione, 26, had used to check into the New York City hotel before UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's murder, was found in his possession.

Joe Root vs Sachin Tendulkar: Comparing their numbers after 151 TestsEngland's Joe Root, currently at the peak of his career, is being tipped as a strong contender to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's all-time Test records. With Root completing 151 Test matches, let's look at how the two batting icons measure up at this stage of their illustrious careers.

Rift in Maha Vikas Aghadi over Maharashtra Leader of Opposition post?The Shiv Sena (UBT), Congress and Sharad Pawar-led NCP, which collectively won 46 of 288 seats in last month's Maharashtra Assembly polls, are all eyeing the post of the Leader of Opposition, sources said.

Why are Israel, US and Turkey bombing Syria's airbases after Assad's fall?Many countries fear powerful weapons left behind by the Assad regime and now in rebel hands could prove detrimental for regional security.

Taylor Swift rewards Eras Tour performers, crew USD 197 million in bonusesTaylor Swift's epic Eras Tour has finally concluded after nearly two years. She paid USD 197 million in bonuses to the performers and crew members over the past two years.

SRK praises Baby John trailer, Varun Dhawan hopes to make 'bade bhaiya' proudShah Rukh Khan praised the trailer of Varun Dhawan-led Baby John, calling it 'energetic and full of action'. At the trailer launch, Atlee credited SRK for inspiring his Bollywood journey. The film releases on December 25.

How SS Rajamouli was a strategic influence behind Pushpa 2's record-breaking runDirector Sukumar credited SS Rajamouli for playing a pivotal role in the success of Pushpa 2: The Rule. Sukumar expressed his gratitude for Rajamouli's vision and support, particularly in helping Pushpa go pan-India.

Singer Bryan Adams visits Victoria Memorial, Ganga ghats in KolkataSinger Bryan Adams recently performed in Kolkata as part of his 'So Happy It Hurts' tour. After his performance, he took some time to explore the city and shared pictures and videos of his experiences on social media.

BB 18: Avinash Mishra shocks housemates after he nominates Vivian DsenaIn the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18, Avinash Mishra nominated Vivian Dsena from the house. This sudden move by Mishra left the housemates in complete shock.

sports.headline: OTD in 2022: Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in ODIs vs BANOn December 10 in 2022, Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in the ODI history. At the age of 24, he also became the youngest player to score a double hundred.

Virat Kohli makes critical changes ahead of Gabba Test: Harbhajan breaks downVirat Kohli made some critical changes in his game ahead of the 3rd Test at the Gabba. Harbhajan Singh pointed out that Kohli was working on his back-foot game to tackle the bounce.

Harbhajan Singh hopes Head-Siraj row ends after ICC sanctions: Enough is enoughFormer spinner Harbhajan Singh is hoping that the Mohammed Siraj-Travis Head has come to an end after both men were given sanctions by the ICC for their actions during the Adelaide Test. Both Siraj and Head were given one demerit point for their actions and the Indian pacer was also fined 20 percent of his match fees.

No change to India's batting order in intense training session in AdelaideIndia players went straight into the nets after their heavy loss in Adelaide. KL Rahul and Yashavsi Jaiswal continued to come out to bat first in the nets, indicating that they might continue to open in the Test series.

Why India should not drop Harshit Rana for Brisbane TestIndia pacer Harshit Rana copped a lot of criticism for his bowling in the pink ball Test match at Adelaide. However, the India team should persist with the pacer for at least one more Test match, set to be played in Brisbane.

Real Madrid will have to play UEFA Champions League playoffs: Carlo AncelottiReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti has admitted that his side may have to get into the next round of the UEFA Champions League through the playoffs ahead of their clash with Atalanta on Tuesday, December 10.

Justin Langer's sacking helped Travis Head flourish: Tim PaineFormer Australia captain Tim Paine feels that the sacking of Justin Langer was key to Travis Head flourishing in all formats of the game. Paine said that the freedom that Pat Cummins and Andrew McDonald have given Head has helped him reach the peak of his prowess.

Rohit Sharma's blunders and India's limp loss in pink-ball Test vs Australia Not many expected India to suffer a limp loss like they did in the second Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. After hammering Australia by 295 runs in Perth under Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy, India were humbled by 10 wickets in Adelaide. India conceded the momentum after a one-sided defeat in the pink-ball Test.

Jonathan Trott to continue as Afghanistan coach for 2025The Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has confirmed the extension of Jonathan Trott's contract as the head coach of the national cricket team through 2025.

Premier League referee David Coote sacked after disciplinary investigationDavid Coote's Premier League refereeing career ended abruptly after PGMOL sacked him for breaching professional conduct following investigations into his Liverpool comments and alleged substance use, signalling a strong stance on maintaining integrity within English football officiating.

DC's new recruit Vipraj takes UP to Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy quartersRinku Singh remained composed, but the lesser-known Vipraj Nigam stole the spotlight as both players showcased superb finishing skills to lead Uttar Pradesh into the quarter-finals of the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy.

Premier League: Alisson back in Liverpool training after almost two monthsLiverpool received a timely morale boost as Alisson Becker and Diogo Jota returned to training, enhancing their prospects for the UEFA Champions League clash against Girona. Alisson's fitness and Jota's availability added much-needed depth to Arne Slot's squad.

Harry Brook is the best player in the world: Joe Root England star Joe Root reckons Harry Brook is by far and away the best player in the world. Root, 33, currently holds the top spot in the ICC rankings for batters, with Brook just one place below him.

Don't doubt Rohit Sharma's captaincy, his ability to bounce back: Kapil DevAustralia vs India: Legendary Kapil Dev said he is confident of Rohit Sharma's ability to bounce back from setbacks. Rohit is under considerable pressure after India lost the second Test in Adelaide by 10 wickets.

Gukesh loses lead after stunning comeback from Liren in Game 12World Chess Championship: Indian challenger D. Gukesh suffered a setback in the 12th game of the World Chess Championship, losing to defending champion Ding Liren of China. The victory allowed Ding to bounce back and level the match at six points apiece on Monday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
